intro: Alyssum gadorense, commonly known as the Canary Island alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid native habitat. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. Alyssum gadorense is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
